about.summary: An awesome iTerm2 backend for Matplotlib, so you can plot directly in your terminal.

name: itermplot
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "itermplot" %}
{% set version = "0.331" %}

package:
  name: "{{ name|lower }}"
  version: "{{ version }}"

source:
  url: "https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz"
  sha256: 0f4099872a78b3a13d899c7a1d0e04ea9693af06b6f23f5a8c279dc646833141

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: python
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv"

requirements:
  host:
    - matplotlib-base
    - numpy
    - pip
    - python
    - six
  run:
    - matplotlib-base
    - numpy
    - python
    - six

test:
  imports:
    - itermplot

about:
  home: "http://github.com/daleroberts/itermplot"
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  # https://github.com/daleroberts/itermplot/issues/39
  # Adding a "generic" MIT license text there just as a placeholder until the
  # author issues one.
  license_file: {{ RECIPE_DIR }}/LICENSE
  summary: "An awesome iTerm2 backend for Matplotlib, so you can plot directly in your terminal."
  doc_url: http://github.com/daleroberts/itermplot
  dev_url: http://github.com/daleroberts/itermplot

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - nehaljwani
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.6.17
